alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 6:10AM CST until January 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow and blowing snow with additional accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Wheeler County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until noon CST today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information. Blustery winds may result in residual blowing and drifting snow, even after the falling snow stops. Be prepared for slick spots and reduced visibility at times.
